newsitem.title: USA: DuPont Merck to sell generics lines to staff.
newsitem.headline: DuPont Merck to sell generics lines to staff.

text.p: DuPont Merck Pharmaceutical Co, a research-based partnership between DuPont Co and Merck & Co Inc, said Monday it was selling its generics and multi-source business lines to a group of company executives for an undisclosed amount of cash.
The new company will be known as Endo Pharmaceuticals Inc, and will be headed by Carol Ammon, currently president, North America, for DuPont Merck.
Sales of generic and branded multisource drugs to be marketed by the new company totaled about $100 million of overall sales of $1.4 billion in 1996, DuPont Merck said.
It said that Chase Securities Inc was providing the debt financing for the deal whereas private investment firm Kelso & Co and senior management were providing the necessary equity financing.
About 35 current employees of DuPont Merck's generics business will be offered employment with the new company, which will continue to be headquartered in Wilmington, Del., the company said.
